website_summaries.verdict: If you'd rather not deal with power cords and outlets, the Thera Cane might be just what the doctor ordered. Simple, but surprisingly effective and incredibly versatile.
pros: Multiple nodes deliver deep pressure to knots, loosening up stiff muscles and improving blood flow while you work
Sturdy construction allows users to apply maximum pressure with confidence
Versatile design works on virtually any muscle group
Praised for its efficacy at loosening knots and reducing aches and pains
cons: Requires a bit of experimentation to get the hang of using it

customer_reviews.title: Best money spent.
customer_reviews.text: The cure for the tender knots in my neck from the back of my head to the ends of my shoulders. Best money I’ve ever spent on amazon. Seriously. Great quality. Use it everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Here is you very own Physical Therapist
customer_reviews.text: This is a life saver and can save you $$$ for all the massages, acupuncture, cupping, chiropractor and physical therapy visits. I live with chronic pain and this has been a life saver. It helps with knots in your muscles and tension spots. There is a booklet to show you how to use for each body part.
customer_reviews.author: Purplebutterfly911

customer_reviews.title: Still Serving Its Purpose
customer_reviews.text: This arrived clearly used. It had scratches and scuffs and was dirty. This was supposed to be a Christmas gift for my sister-in-law. Since we were unable to return it, my husband kept it for himself. It does what it’s supposed to as far as it’s purpose, and he’s satisfied with it, just unhappy I ordered new and received used.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne Harris

customer_reviews.title: Waste of my money
customer_reviews.text: Sorry. This was a waste of my money, as it didn't do anything for my needs. Having said that, I can say the construction and design is very nice. I just didn't appreciate it. I did read the instructions and my sister showed me how to use it properly, as she is a PT. Still, I regret spending the money on this. I would suggest buying a used one, as the high quality would make it resalable and it might be cheaper for you to try it if you buy it used. I will pass mine on to a person in need.
customer_reviews.author: Loves Teaching

customer_reviews.title: Practical
customer_reviews.text: Love it so much, My sister always steals it from me, but overall, it is very comfortable to use, I train BJJ and MMA and I get back pain in a while. I also worked at a climbing gym next door to my training gym, both places had these cane massagers, and I would always see my trainers and co-workers use them. Never thought I would get one, until one day I had horrible shoulder blade pain, one of my managers gave me to try it, and the same day I went and ordered the same one. It a life changer especially for athletes.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: Almost a religious experience.  Allows one to massage hard-to-reach or difficult areas quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Neck and shoulder pain have been my issue lately. Too difficult, or in some areas impossible, to address these issues by myself with a massage ball or roller, so I ordered this to give it a try. I just received it 30 minutes ago. I am already online here to rate this as a 5+ star rating, and in all categories. I was worried it (ie, the curve part) might be a bit small for my very large frame and neck--not an issue. The fact that I'm doing a review (rare) and typing this much (difficult prior to 30 minutes ago) almost says it all. I will update this review if I encounter any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ed C.

customer_reviews.title: This has reduced my back pain a lot!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this product. I learned about it from my physical therapist. I could not endure the PT treatments (two back surgeries), but this cane relieves my knotted back muscles and also solved my tight, painful stiff neck. Friends have tried it and it doesn't seem to help their particular issues. But I use it almost daily. I suggest also purchasing The Trigger Point Therapy Workbook: Your Self-Treatment Guide for Pain Relief, 2nd Edition. It is clearly and helpfully written and helps you isolate those painful knots that may be somewhere other than the pain is.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I no longer need a wife
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended to me by a friend I have who has always been single and never seemed bothered or lonesome by this fact. Once I bought this product, I understood. No longer will you need companionship. This guy is half the price of a cheap massage and twice as effective, and you save yourself the awkward conversations that typically ensue. It also comes with a nice little guide which has a long list of different ways to use it. It's pretty much a full-body massage tool. Your back, shoulders, legs, it does the whole nine yards. It's extremely ineffective as an actual cane unless you are a dwarf, however. Please use as intended - not for walking stability.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Mathewson

customer_reviews.title: Very Uneffective
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how much I disliked this product due to the rave reviews from even people in the medical field. The product is pure plastic and stiff and hard to use on the skin and even over clothes. There are waaay better products out there for waaay cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: MelyM

customer_reviews.title: try first elsewhere, and check return policy!
customer_reviews.text: The material this is made of is not "heavy duty" like the one I used at my Physical Therapy office. It is supposed to be rigid, and this one is made of plastic that bends at the hook when using it . It's not supposed to do that. I wrote to the Amazon seller, who was of no help. This is a product that would be better to see and try out first. As it is a health care product, my seller deemed it as an "unreturnable" item---which I did not see in the product listing. So....I'd try one out first and know you are purchasing the same. These seem to be manufactured with varying levels of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm literally hooked
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding! This is free shiatsu, especially good for upper reaches on shoulders and neck. Between too much sitting behind a computer and guitar playing (sitting), this is going to provide a lot of relief. I keep picking it up for another round of pressure point therapy. It does give a little, but that's probably a good thing, not to the point where it feels like it will break--just enough so as not to be over doing the therapy.
customer_reviews.author: T. Washington

customer_reviews.title: I wish I'd bought one sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I used one of these in physical therapy years ago, but only recently purchased one for myself. I wish I hadn't waited. I work at a computer all day and get bad knots in my upper back, in addition to having herniated discs in my neck. This is a fantastic invention. It helps so much to be able to directly target the knots. It might be nice to have some kind of foam grip that you can move around to wherever you need to grip it, though. My hands get really tired pretty quickly when I use it. Still, 100% completely worth it. Probably the best Amazon purchase I've made during the pandemic!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Altieri

customer_reviews.title: Can reach those knots ok your back/shoulder area!
customer_reviews.text: I just recently discovered this at physical therapy. Best idea ever lol. The item is shipped as 1 solid piece. Some others come in 2 parts. Light but sturdy enough to use some force to help get knots out. My only complaint is a few of the round ball ends have a plastic seam from the mold. If you are using it with clothing in-between you may not notice. But you can tell I'm bare skin. At some point maybe I'll get movotated enough to smooth those out but until then I'll just use a different end.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome relief!!!
customer_reviews.text: Heard about this from a young relative at Thanksgiving. She brought it out when us older folks were discussing aches and pains. Sheard about it from a friend. I tried it on my achy and knitted shoulders and neck, it was awesome. I could not believe how little pressure it took and so easy to use. I bought one immediately and keep it next to my tv chair and use it when watching tv, sometimes at my bedside for just before going to bed. I highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable!
customer_reviews.text: I went on social media asking how to get knots out of my back while the professionals are shut down. Many people posted this, so I fell for it and ordered it. Dear lawd! I have had it for only a few hours and I can move my neck again. At first I felt the tickles and pain and resistance. That meant it found the spots. This thing is amazing. I will be using this to keep my mobility and my sanity these days. This is going to make an amazing gift to send as well. Worth more than every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Elynoon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for daily pain relief
customer_reviews.text: I was initially really skeptical about this product but I finally made the plunge after being in so much constant pain. Although regular massages help greatly, the theracane works wonders because I'm able to find temporary pain relief on a daily basis in between my massages. Even if it's just for a few minutes a day, it makes a difference. It comes with a booklet as well but I feel that it can be used in many ways. It's not always easy to use when used for 20-30 sessions as my arms get tired from holding it up but overall, I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah K.

customer_reviews.title: It takes care of business
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended by a friend. I fiddled around with it for a few minutes, then worked through the instruction manual. It's exactly what I needed... A way to dig in and work through knots that I could never reach on my own. My goal was to break through special spots as maintenance between therapeutic massage appointments. With thanks to working through the manual, I found great release along my collar bone and sternum. The cane isn't for 'relaxation', it's for taking care of business. A bit of sanding edges from the plastic mold and some sesame oil went a long way.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: My husband says this is the best thing I've ever bought on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I'm not proud to admit I buy something on Amazon on an almost weekly basis. This thing is awesome! I saw it at my physical therapist's office and used it there. It works so good - I can finally get the knots out of my neck and shoulder blades! My husband, who is not always the biggest fan of my various purchases loves it as well. He announced it was the best purchase I made, so far. And I've gotten some pretty good stuff...
customer_reviews.author: Christine Basic

customer_reviews.title: RECOMMENDED BY PHYSICAL THERAPIST
customer_reviews.text: Prior to surgery on several levels of my cervical (neck) spine, the surgeon had me try physical therapy. The therapist had one of these "canes" and it felt pretty good on the muscle knots and spasms in my shoulders. Of course, it didn't fix anything, but since then we've used it on occasion when we've sprained a muscle in the back. It's nice to have the knobs along the "cane" to get a good grip when applying gentle pressure.
customer_reviews.author: kandrues53

customer_reviews.title: Amazing once you get the right angle for putting pressure where it's needed.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing ever if you have muscle pain that can be helped by massaging it. I had a knot in my back/shoulder that was causing significant discomfort/pain for several weeks. The wife would help with a massage once in awhile, but this thing allows you to be in control of your own positioning/pressure point. It's amazing once you figure out the best angle/method of using it. It was delivered to my work and I literally let out an audible grown (a good thing) when I started using it...led to a group of people coming to my office to see what was going on...
customer_reviews.author: Raydur

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I got a spasm in my back and we used this in my physical therapy office and I came home and immediately purchased this. I used it about 15 minutes a day for three months and it just provided the best relief. I still have it and use it constantly after a long hard day at work and my shoulders are tight or after a workout and my calves are tight it really helps loosen different body parts that you can use it for so many different parts of the body and it’s super easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Qualm

customer_reviews.title: :::Deep pressure massager:::
customer_reviews.text: I was so hesitant to order this product. I watched YouTube videos and read most of the reviews. Had my eyes on this before Xmas. Bought it and loved it immediately. 😍Kinda remind of the foam roller I uses at the gym. This is much much better though. You get down to the nitty gritty and nots. I made sure I wiped it off before using it. The packing was horrible they just throw it in huge box no padding and all, this why I gave it 4 ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Instead of 5. 🤷🏽‍♀️ Love it nonetheless. 🥰
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Ritetrus

customer_reviews.title: GREAT product
customer_reviews.text: I love the thera cane. A friend of mine turned me on to this product and I have never looked back. The shape of the product allows you to work out knots on any part of your back or any other body part for that matter. Previously, I would lay on the floor with a lacrosse ball under my back to try to hit the hard-to-get spots but this product allows me to quickly and conveniently work out knots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deep tissue, Easy to use and comes with application guide.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for myself after a friend told me about it and let me try it out. It arrived and was put to use for 1day.......then it was gone from my possession. 😕 Don’t worry, it wasn’t broken, stolen or lost, just rehomed in the same household. My 12yo son trains and competes in a Brazilian Jiu Jitsu and once he used it, he liked that it reached deep down, so I purchased another one, but the Max. 😆
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: If you’ve never felt a TheraCane on your back, you need to. I have two of these. Well, I HAD two until someone stole the one I had at work. These get to those hard to reach spots on your back and depending on your own strength and pressure, you get deep tissue massages from it. Pressure points are easily reached and pain is relieved. Excellent product. Stop using a tennis ball against a wall and buy one.
customer_reviews.author: MzCat

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Personal Massage Tool for Back
customer_reviews.text: My friend's mother who's a occupational therapist actually recommended this just for general back massaging since it allows you to comfortably reach different parts of your back to work on tight areas. It does take some getting use to for positioning the cane at different angles. It still doesn't beat another person giving you a back massage, but if you live alone, this is a great alternative. The stick comes with several appendages that come out so it makes it easy to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Abben H.

customer_reviews.title: 10 Stars!
customer_reviews.text: OHHH YEAH! This cane is amazing for getting knots out of your back. I love that you don't have to count on someone to rub your back, get the right spot and rub hard enough. I can rub those spots out easily with this cane. Since I got this can I rub my stress spots more often and actually prevents those knots from coming. I absolutely love this cane and want to buy one for my office as well. 5 STARS!
customer_reviews.author: Kalsterk

customer_reviews.title: Bled from first try.  Be sure to buff the knobs!
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t realize that the main “knob” or knot on the cane wasn’t buffed smooth and ended up with a really bad scrape and scab. It peeled off a layer of skin. So beware to smooth out any bumps. Can be hard to find your knots and get the right grip of the cane while rubbing the knob into the knot.
customer_reviews.author: boshelle

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver!!
customer_reviews.text: This removed chronic, years in the making knots to my occipital head and scapula in three days of intense self-massage! Hundreds of dollars on massage and yoga did not provide lasting relief but the BLUE Thera Cane did! I have one at work and another at home. As ridiculous as this sounds, this saved my sanity because of the constant knot pain I was in. This thing is AMAZING, I kid you not! But get the BLUE, not the green. The blue allows for the right amount of self-pressure, the green is too flexible and feels like it could snap.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: If you have chronic pain, then you need this
customer_reviews.text: I have chronic pain. This is the only device that I’ve found other than heat to help me. People with back pain, Arthritis, fibromyalgia, and other chronic pain disorders, you know who you are; you definitely need this weird looking device. Lightweight and reaches all the places you can’t.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy W Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: This changed my life.
customer_reviews.text: The amount of pain I feel in my upper back and my neck as decreased exponentially since purchasing this cane. It sits by my desk in the living room, and it has eliminated most of my tension head aches in my life. This product is sturdy, and the notches offer quite a few options for massaging the various sections of my back at different angles. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who is remotely thinking about buying one.
customer_reviews.author: DJS

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves this!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my husband. After his physical therapy sessions, his therapist recommended purchasing one of these, and he'll sit on the couch and watch episodes while using this thing all afternoon! It's helped with his shoulders and back where he can't reach spots that need the pressure that this provides. We're thinking of getting one for his dad, who, once we showed it to him, it was hard to get it back he was enjoying it so much too!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Welch

customer_reviews.title: LIFE. CHANGING.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had the cane for 24 hours and I. AM. FLOORED. I’ve suffered from painful lumbar scoliosis for over 20 years and this is the first product I’ve used that’s given me instant relief and results. Feeling each muscle spasm melt away almost instantly and with very minimal effort all while watching TV on my sofa was an incredible experience. I wish I could take this thing everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Feels so much better than just your hands...
customer_reviews.text: I have used these before, it includes a guide of how to properly use. Long story short you can massage anywhere on your body, and it feels like someone else is giving you a massage(in other words applying more pressure than you can apply yourself). Your body can only do so much, and most times your body stops you so you don’t hurt yourself. For example trying to rub your neck, But with this device you can apply enough pressure on the spots that you can’t reach orOn certain spots that you need to press a little harder. Honestly it’s worth 30... Versus paying $200 add a masseuse per session.
customer_reviews.author: Nova

customer_reviews.title: Honest review
customer_reviews.text: This theracane is okay. Its main usefulness is getting to your back, in those hard to reach areas. The theracane is sturdy, but kind of a hassle to use, but it works okay I thought. I'm not sure I am going to use it much though. I am not entirely sorry though i bought it either. This could be someone else's godsend.
customer_reviews.author: tigerced73

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for pain relief
customer_reviews.text: This Theracane was recommended by my physical therapist after having neck surgery. It was a lifesaver. I don’t know what I would have done without it. My husband also used it. He loved it. Great pain relief! I would recommend this to anyone who has neck pain or back pain. It provides immediate relief. The only downfall is once you remove the device and some incidences the pain comes back. But in my case the more I used it, the pain eventually subsided. All in all, this is a great tool for pain relief. It sure beats taking a bunch of pain medication.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Helps relieve trigger points
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist suggested I get a Theracane to use at home to supplement the manual treatments he performs at the clinic. This theracane has indeed proven terrific at alleviating those spots: find a point that's tender, and apply a little bit of pressure on the cane, and the cane will transfer the pressure to the point of interest - much easier and more effective than using a lacrosse ball against a wall. It's easy to use and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Color Rubs Off
customer_reviews.text: I will be contacting customer service to return this. Felt and looked like someone spray painted this blue when we finally took it out of the box. Blue paint rubbed off SO easily- powdery and disgusting.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Shur

customer_reviews.title: Must buy to help relive knots
customer_reviews.text: Bought the thera cane after seeing all of the reviews on the product. I must say that I was not disappointed. I use this almost everyday and my shoulders/upper back have been a lot less tense due to the knots being massaged. If you purchase this, you might have to sand the end of the cane as there is a tiny raised part that pinches/scratches from the manufacturing process. You absolutely need to purchase this if you have problems relieving tension in your muscles. Now all my in-laws want to buy one.
customer_reviews.author: Ava

customer_reviews.title: And into the ether my reveiw went.
customer_reviews.text: I was against buying this because it looks like a gimmick. My wife overruled me and in the cart it went. Delivery was quick and to work it went. After a few uses away my disbelief went. And now this review has gone and went. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Logan James W. III

customer_reviews.title: Trigger Point Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I was considering a different cane vs. the Theracane, but after all was said and done, decided to go with the original. I am very glad I did. It is a lifesaver to get to spots on my shoulders that are in spasm. I am also learning how to use it on my lower back while laying down. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: McGeeVRJL

customer_reviews.title: I have 1 at home and 1 in my truck, keeps me as normal as can be
customer_reviews.text: Great for self massage for pain relief. I already own 2 Theracane Brand massagers and my daughter asked for one for Christmas so I bought 4 more for gifts this year. I've had 3 neck surgeries and need one more, Theracane is necessary for me.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: It works, and it's worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is able to target small deep areas of tension that you can't reach. When the tennis balls aren't doing the trick, and you just wish you could get someone to dig into you back/shoulder area this thing will magically save your life. I was amazed at how deep you can get it to go, and how precisely you can get all those tiny knots. You will feel an instant release of pressure and relief. It usually comes in an ugly shade of green pretty much anywhere it's sold. This was the only place I found it in blue. You should definitely give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Won’t use anything else!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and works better than foam rolling! I’m an avid runner and was lucky I got to use one of these before buying my own. This cane is super sturdy and effective at massaging sore spots. You determine the amount of pressure applied and the circular knobs provide a “pinpoint” to the desired area versus foam rolling which is more of a general or “broader” and less effective at providing pain relief/massage. Totally worth it and don’t regret my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel in DC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results
customer_reviews.text: My buddy had a Theracane and allowed me to use to it as I complained about shoulder/neck pain. One session I was sold. Woke up this morning neck stiff and sore; heard the dogs and went down to see the package on my porch. Opened it sat down and massaged for about 39 seconds before finding a trigger point in my shoulder and with a quick turn of my neck I felt it ripple down to my shoulder blades. Chiropractic adjustment alone would cost me $40 but add in a massage and it'd be well over $100. Theracane paid for itself in about 30 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Batman

customer_reviews.title: It arrived on time and in good condition. She has bragged how this is really ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a co-worker because she does not have internet in her home. It arrived on time and in good condition. She has bragged how this is really helping her where she needs it. It was her doctor who recommended this. When she stopped by to pick it up, we were talking and she started using it and said that it was fantastic. She has shoulder problems and this helps work out knots that she gets from tension.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best trigger point device I've used
customer_reviews.text: When you need to get to a part of the body that needs help this is the devise to use. There are so many good things that I've used this to help when I need some re-leaf or loosening up of a part of my body. It's great, get the book too and find all the trigger points in your body and how to help them when needed. I would recommend the Thera Cane Massager to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Middleman

customer_reviews.title: Ahhhhh relief
customer_reviews.text: I have used this in my physical therapists office and bought a cheaper version, but returned it to get this one as the difference is very obvious. This one is much sturdier with smoother knobs. Helps with the serious knots I have in my neck and back. I lean against a tennis ball against the wall but find that this gets those pesky spots much better
customer_reviews.author: nadine chiang

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for self care
customer_reviews.text: I am a Chiropractor and a previous massage therapist. I love these canes!! I got several of them for my patients to use during care in office and I highly recommend they buy one for themselves at home. My patients look forward to their 'cane time' and it has greatly helped bridge the gap between educating patients about self care/stretching and them actually doing it!
customer_reviews.author: Alex S

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful pain relief!!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 6 stars if possible. I have had knots in my back and shoulder area for years. My husband was always able to massage them out. Since he developed arthritis in his hands he couldn’t do it anymore and I was desperate for relief. This cane is amazing. After several days of use my shoulder was so much better. It’s easy to use and does a great job. Wish I had known about this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Farmer Girl

customer_reviews.title: No more pain
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. If you have any doubts, just buy it. I was having sharp back pain from slouching at work and a few days of using this got rid of my pain and a huge knot ive had on my back forever. This thing HURTS when you find a trigger point and press hard, but you can feel it loosen up the longer you hold it. You have to play around with it and see what areas need some pressure. its a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Great for my migraines
customer_reviews.text: This is my 6th theracane because Everytime I loan it to someone they love it so much they keep it! Found out about this product 20 years ago from my massage therapist,then saw them in my chiropractors office! Great trigger point relief. Super easy to use and comes with a book!
customer_reviews.author: Papa & Honey Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Knots? BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: Using theracane has improved my life significantly. Okay, so you're skeptical. No seriously, this is amazing. My girlfriend used to have to dig her heel into my back with extreme force but now I can do it myself, but with more force. It's honestly amazing. If you have any hard knots in your back please please take my word and but this for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: This is the most amazing thing
customer_reviews.text: I have one at home, one at my office and have bought several for friends. We have nicknamed it "the thing". If you have ever woken up with that stiff neck and knew the next few days would be misery, you need this thing. If you have ever used a tennis ball, golf ball or doorknob etc to try and get pressure onto a sore spot, then you need this thing. If you have ever twisted, turned or just moved and felt that twinge of pain, pinch or tingle, then you need this thing. Seriously, this is the best thing ever!
customer_reviews.author: eldner

customer_reviews.title: A new prized possession
customer_reviews.text: This thing lets you put pressure on the exact spot needed. I'm a 70 year old guy of 6' and 200 lbs and it is the right size for me. I can get relief on pressure points with little effort. Easy to manipulate and everything is in just the right place. I havent' had it long but so far it is one of my pain management precious'. I would recommend this Thera Cane Massager to anyone especially my friends. It does what it claims.
customer_reviews.author: Megal

customer_reviews.title: Essential to my pain relief
customer_reviews.text: I work at a physical therapy clinic and we use one of these for soft tissue release. I love it for myself because it's hard for me to massage myself and most people aren't able to apply the amount of pressure I need in order to feel relief. So the theracane is a great way to get pain relief, without anyone else's aid, and at any time you need it!
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: Great for working out muscle knots in your body!
customer_reviews.text: I like to use this theracane to release tension in my muscles especially for my neck and shoulders. I like the multiple knobs you can use with different angles. I recommend this for my patients to use at home along with their stretches. This is a great tool to have at home or work.
customer_reviews.author: Hlee

customer_reviews.title: Your Personal Physical Therapist
customer_reviews.text: My Physical Therapist recommended this for me as I couldn't reach my trigger points to alleviate pain. I think I'm addicted! This is easy to use and gets to the right spots. Too bad I can't just fold it up and put it in my purse. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders!
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these in 1994 when I was diagnosed with fibromyalgia. It helped immensely. Somehow I lost that one and I'm so glad to find this on Amazon! Works great! Be sure to drink lots of water after a session with the cane. Lots of toxins are released and you need to flush them from your body.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Freimann

customer_reviews.title: A great all over body massager
customer_reviews.text: The Thera Cane Massager is fantastic. It's the thing I always needed! It helps me get to knots in my own back and work through sore muscles. It is great for legs and the neck too. The design gives you great leverage. It is especially wonderful for hard to reach places. It's great for all parts of your body. I have not even fully explored all of the possibilities! It is well made and easy to grip. It is durable, and it can handle the pressure. I love the Thera Cane! It has quickly become a must have.
customer_reviews.author: A. Duramonov

customer_reviews.title: it's sturdy and includes paper instructions as to what points to ...
customer_reviews.text: While I was extremely excited to receive this product, it just didn't meet the high quality benchmark I set for my purchases. Sure, it's sturdy and includes paper instructions as to what points to press (same ones you have online). What would make this product better is to actually have a website (with videos) that explains the different types of exercises you can do and explain the benefits of each specific exercise a little more thoroughly.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: It did help relieve some tension in my chest, shoulder, and back after two open heart surgeries. I had to be really gentle because the knobs are hard.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Willliams

customer_reviews.title: Looks kind of crazy but wow! It works!!!
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist recommended I get this to massage my neck and back. Oh man does it ever feel good! Picked it up and gave myself a massage right out of the box! Didn't even read the instructions!! It has helped me so much and my husband loves it too! Saves him from having to rub my back all the time! Great tool to hit this sore spots that you just can't reach.
customer_reviews.author: DrPepper1330

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: doesn't really relieve anything. I wanted to use it for the back of my shoulder but you have to use shoulder muscles to use the device. So, you really can't penetrate into the sore muscles. Kind of defeats the purpose. Too long now to send it back so it just hangs on the edge of a counter.
customer_reviews.author: mitchellm

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, not as sturdy as my first one ?!
customer_reviews.text: I could easily give it 5 stars, but this one sadly is not as sturdy as my fist one bought 3+years ago. I ordered this one as extra to use it in my office. I don’t know why they changed the original?! I may return it.
customer_reviews.author: Moghadam

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: This gets the knots out of those hard to reach spots in my back. I have a chronic issue which causes lots of tight muscles in my back and this gives me such relief. FYI, a friend bought a knock-off and it's not as good as this one --too flexible. I recommend you buy the real thing. It's also great for massaging the bottoms of your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Your spouse will love you. This crazy looking cane is awesome. It allows you to hit those hard to reach knots with the pressure you want. I had bunch of knots in lower back they are all gone. This thing also takes away soreness from working out. Highly recommended plus no more bugging the wife or hubby for a massage.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best inventions! They are easy to use and are very effective (especially for scapula/shoulder/neck pain! They also last forever. We’ve had ours for a few years now. I use it every night and it still looks brand new!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S Delgaudio

customer_reviews.title: It’s ugly but it works!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely don’t understand how this product look better than something you hang your plants on. However, when I have knots on my shoulders this tool truly gets the work done. My chiropractor recommended and it works. If you don’t see yourself truly using it in a regular don’t get it because then you’ll just have an ugly metal thing in your house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Tool
customer_reviews.text: I received one of these Thera Canes (green) when going through physical therapy years ago, but it was lost in a move. I was very pleased to find this on Amazon, as it enabled me to reach areas of my back that can't be reached without this tool. This blue Thera Cane is exactly the same as the green one I previously had. They're identical in function and stiffness. This is a great tool that I wouldn't want to be without.
customer_reviews.author: AnnTop Contributor: Watercolor Painting

customer_reviews.title: might be a new bff
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I wish I'd gotten one a long time ago. Rather than hoping (in vain) to get a back rub every day from the spouse, I can now pinpoint exactly where my knots are (which I get regularly) and work them myself. Great for knots in the upper back and lower shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Love it sturdy helps
customer_reviews.text: I was introduced to visit Physical Therapy it is really great especially for your neck pain! it’s great because you can get in there you know where you hurt the most . I went with this brand because it’s more sturdy than the other ones
customer_reviews.author: Kristal

customer_reviews.title: Great for pain on back & shoulders
customer_reviews.text: Was recommended by our physical therapist. That's what they use at their office. It really relieves pains by pressing on pressure points. It's great for the back where we usually cant reach.
customer_reviews.author: winnie

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use, maximum relief
customer_reviews.text: I have an electric hand held massager that vibrates...I call it a thumper. It is heavy and hard to reach areas of my neck and back..easier for someone else to use on me. The Thera cane is light weight, sturdy, easy to use myself, and I can pinpoint the exact spot that needs relief. It's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: CSW

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for a sore spot
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to hold to press and rotate on a sore muscle in the neck, shoulder or back. I used to have to try and lie on a tennis ball but this is easy to press against the spot and release the muscle. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Utilitarian ultra unwinding tool!
customer_reviews.text: A friend who’s a PT PhD suggested I use one of these years ago. Lost my old one, replaced it. These things are seemingly invincible- to heck with Twinkies and cockroaches - these will survive the apocalypse! And they’re one of the most effective ways I’ve found to work out muscle pain/tightness by yourself. It came with a small illustrated how-to booklet, but if you want to go further, use it in conjunction with a book on trigger-point therapy. That and some tennis balls... look it up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hits the pressure points.
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful product. My doctor advised me to buy the theracane for knotted back muscle. I didn't want nor could afford PT 3 times a week. Used it according to the instructions with great relief. I could definitely tell it was working within a week. Recently got my son one and he likes it as well after his daily workouts.
customer_reviews.author: teresa munlin

customer_reviews.title: Thera Cane, yes!
customer_reviews.text: The Thera Cane was recommended to me by my former physical therapist. I had shoulder and upper back issues earlier this year and spent 3 months in PT. Problems began to arise again and I can't afford to go back to PT for now. I am very happy with the results using the Thera Cane and I believe the ease of use, quality of the Cane are directly responsible for my satisfaction! I looked at other brands which cost less however the strength is lessened as a result of lesser circumference of other canes. I'm very happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: alklev

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Theracane at my chiropractors office nearly 20 years ago..........still have it, still use it, still love it. I purchased this one for a dear friend and she loves it too. This is a wonderful product; lightweight yet durable and easy to use. Would recommend this product time and again.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah E.

customer_reviews.title: Great for muscle knots
customer_reviews.text: I love this. Growing up my dad had a TheraCane so I thought I would give it a try. I had a large, painful knot under my shoulder blade for several weeks that wasn't getting better. I used this 2 days in a row and felt so much better. It was the only thing that helped when I was in pain and miserable
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist recommended this. I got one just before a 2 week trip. It fit in my check in bag just fine, and was great for working out the kinks in my shoulders from carrying suitcases to cramming into airplane seats.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret N

customer_reviews.title: Best invention ever!
customer_reviews.text: My neck and back go out a lot. I cannot turn my head at all without it catching at times. This thing has helped me function. Very easy to grab it and put the end exactly where I need it (just under my shoulder blade) and pull however hard I can stand it. I take this on trips and aometimes fight over it with my husband!
customer_reviews.author: Micah Epley

customer_reviews.title: You need this
customer_reviews.text: Great product for pains and aches in your neck and back. We have a few so my husband can take 1 with him when he travels. There’s nothing else that helps if I sleep on my neck wrong. May be temporary relief but worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LGS

customer_reviews.title: So helpful!
customer_reviews.text: SUCH A GREAT PRODUCT! I get knots and stiff spots constantly. With this I am able to reach every spot on my back and put the perfect amount of pressure. The handles are very well thought out!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Milton

customer_reviews.title: Useful, but could be stronger
customer_reviews.text: Used this for about 15 months and it helped break through some tough fascia tension and open up some muscles, but I think it could be made of a stronger material as it just shattered into four pieces over my shoulder this morning. Also, I wish there wasn't that abrasive writing depressed into the side of the straight bar area. A number of times, I've wanted to use that section to roll out muscles, but it just kind of scratches you.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This product came recommended to me from a YouTuber who is a physical therapist. It has literally saved my sanity by correcting insanely painful knots and muscle cramps in areas of my back that are normally impossible to reach with typical massagers, etc. It helped to alleviate pain within minutes when used properly. I wish I could give this 10 stars!
customer_reviews.author: bd

customer_reviews.title: It’s better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: I’m a retired therapist. This tool would be difficult to use for an average or older person. The construction material is above average. But application of the tool for desired results can be difficult to exact pinpoint the exact area.
customer_reviews.author: teresa dekeyser

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have one at work and one at home. I get knots and my shoulders are always tight. This helps a lot. I find a knot and put the pressure on and it slowly goes away. I almost want to get one for my car, but there are enough distractions on the roads.
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Thera Cane. It works great for neck knots from stress and if you have sciatic pain, you can find the "spot" where the pain originates in your hip, apply light pressure and feel instant relief. I gave the first one to my mechanic who complained of sciatic pain. He was able to avoid a series of trips to Chiropractor. Just remember to not use too much pressure, you could cause a bruise and light pressure is all that is necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Donna McBride

customer_reviews.title: Love my thera cane
customer_reviews.text: Recommended to me by a Physical Therapist so that I could self massage my pain trigger points primarily in my neck and shoulders. This product is very easy to use, works very well, and is worth the money paid. I have recommended this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: A nice inexpensive way to relieve pain!
customer_reviews.text: I sit at a computer for work. I end up with tense shoulders, a sore ITB and get knots in my neck. I use this on the trigger points and it really offers intense relief without paying for a massage (which I also do when I can afford it.) It was recommended to me by my sister who is a physical therapist. I actually bought 2- one for home and one for the office.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Giffin

customer_reviews.title: Works Great – I show it off to all my friends
customer_reviews.text: This works great! 10-20 minutes of use and my back tension is greatly reduced. You have to "go hunting" for the knots and it is quite painful once you find them and apply pressure. But the aftermath is so worth it. I don't have experience with other, "fancier" canes, but I like the simplicity of this. I also use the shorter knobs on my calves and hamstrings after strenuous running.
customer_reviews.author: Deanne

customer_reviews.title: Knot in my shoulder blade. This helps!!
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist recommened this. Could not reach the knot in my shoulder blade and my husband was too scared to dig in the muscle for me. Now I have relief. Brought it to work, and it can travel in small bags. There's instructions how to work on other muscles, too.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Ehlers

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Tool for Pressure Point Massage
customer_reviews.text: If you've never used a Theracane then you need to try one. This is great for hitting pressure points that you just can't reach by yourself. If you have tension in your shoulders or back or even hips this is a great tool. I get tension headaches and all of it sits in my shoulders. This is one of the best tools I've found for self-massage and hitting those pressure points with great pressure. This particular theracane is small enough to travel with in the car/trips or to keep at your desk at work (which is where mine is).
customer_reviews.author: Aria

customer_reviews.title: Takes some practice
customer_reviews.text: This thing really digs out the knots I get in my back. It saves me a couple trips a month to the massage therapist. At $60 dollars a visit this item is a god send. I lean against my sofa back with the hooked side ball pressed into the spasm and rotate the cane basically grinding out the spasm to release it.
customer_reviews.author: CJfalco

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Our physical therapist showed this to my son so he could massage out his back/shoulders on his own. It works so well, I love using it too! It is definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend to provide pain relief!
customer_reviews.text: I was experiencing pain and learned from a friend that this tool could provide relief. Sure enough they were right! The directions that came with it were really helpful in making it effective as I would have not used it properly. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I have a pain in my shoulder that I can't reach to massage - this odd shaped "thing" really does help. I'm not saying that the pain has gone away, but this certainly helps to calm the pain down. And, it really is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalie Mc

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have one in their house
customer_reviews.text: My sister is a licensed massage therapist, and she told me to get this for a bad pain in the back of my neck/shoulder. Good call. This let me put some solid pressure on spots I'd have a tough time reaching otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Maness

customer_reviews.title: Love it! It works!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd one. I purchased my 1st Thera Cane in the 1990's when diagnosed with fibromyalgia. It saved me. This cane reaches places no one else can get to muchness yourself and allows you to get to your trigger points areas and release the pain. Love it~ Recently I had spinal surgery and my upper thoracic area went out from over reaching. I had terrible pain for 2 weeks before I finally decided to look online to see if they still sold the same one I had purchased in the past. Sure enough! Yes! So happy! I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lynette J.

product_meta.title: Thera Cane Massager (Blue)
product_meta.description: Color:BlueEase your aches and pains with the Thera Cane Massager. This simple and effective self-massager makes it easy to apply pain relieving deep compression directly to hard knotted points anywhere on your body, breaking up tension in even the hardest to reach muscle areas. The Thera Cane works by applying pressure to the muscles, which helps to maximize the flow of oxygenated blood. This pressure aids in restoring muscle function by breaking up adhesions in the muscle fibers helping the muscle to work more efficiently. Manufactured with the highest standards the round and smooth contours of the Thera Cane feel comfortable in your hands and glides easily on your muscles. Lifetime guarantee.
feature_bullets: Thera Cane is a trigger point massager
Treat painful knotted muscles on your own
Made in the USA the Thera Cane is 24”x15”x1”
Registered with the FDA for over 30 years

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
